3.invocation: Monitor system log files for specific error patterns and send email notifications when detected.
3.cmd: tail -n 0 -f /var/log/messages /var/log/syslog | grep -Ei 'error_pattern_1|error_pattern_2' | while read line; do echo "$line" | mail -s "Error Detected" recipient@example.com; done

4.invocation: Display the current network interface statistics, including transmitted and received bytes.

6.invocation: Kill a process by its process ID (PID).

7.invocation: Monitor system resource usage (CPU, memory, disk, network) in real-time and log the data to a file.
7.cmd: while true; do top -b -n1 | grep --line-buffered "^CPU\|^Mem\|^Swap" >> system_resource_usage_log.txt; df -h >> system_resource_usage_log.txt; netstat -antp >> system_resource_usage_log.txt; sleep 5; done
